Class StatisticsManager

java.lang.Object
StatisticsManager
public class StatisticsManager extends Object
The StatisticsManager class manages game statistics. The statistics include the number of games played, games won, games lost, total time played, win streak, win percentage, and player name. The statistics are saved and read from a text file.
Author:
anes_

      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • StatisticsManager

      public StatisticsManager()
      Constructs a new instance of StatisticsManager. If the statistics file doesn't exist, it initializes the statistics with default values. Otherwise, it reads the statistics from the file.

  • Method Details

    • setGamesPlayed

      public void setGamesPlayed()
      Increases the number of games played by 1 and saves the updated statistics to the file.

    • setGamesWon

      public void setGamesWon()
      Increases the number of games won by 1, updates the win streak, win percentage, and saves the updated statistics to the file.

    • setGamesLost

      public void setGamesLost()
      Increases the number of games lost by 1, resets the win streak, updates the win percentage, and saves the updated statistics to the file.

    • addSeconds

      public void addSeconds(int seconds)
      Adds the specified number of seconds to the total time played, updates the time played value, and saves the updated statistics to the file.
      Parameters:
      seconds - The number of seconds to add to the total time played.

    • timeToSeconds

      private int timeToSeconds(String time)
      Converts the time in "mm:ss" format to total seconds.
      Parameters:
      time - The time in "mm:ss" format.
      Returns:
      The total number of seconds.

    • secondsToTime

      private String secondsToTime(int seconds)
      Converts the total seconds to time in "mm:ss" format.
      Parameters:
      seconds - The total number of seconds.
      Returns:
      The time in "mm:ss" format.

    • setWinStreak

      public void setWinStreak(int winStreak)
      Sets the win streak to the specified value and saves the updated statistics to the file.
      Parameters:
      winStreak - The new win streak value.

    • initializeStatistics

      public void initializeStatistics()
      Initializes the statistics with default values and saves them to the file.

    • readStatisticsFromFile

      private void readStatisticsFromFile()
      Reads the statistics from the file and updates the instance variables. If an error occurs during reading, the stack trace is printed.

    • saveStatisticsToFile

      private void saveStatisticsToFile()
      Saves the current statistics to the file. If an error occurs during writing, the stack trace is printed.

    • isFileExists

      private boolean isFileExists()
      Checks if the statistics file exists.
      Returns:
      true if the file exists, false otherwise.

    • updateWinPercentage

      private void updateWinPercentage()
      Updates the win percentage based on the number of games played and won. If no games have been played, the win percentage is set to 0.0.

    • updateWinStreak

      private void updateWinStreak()
      Increases the win streak by 1.

    • resetWinStreak

      private void resetWinStreak()
      Resets the win streak to 0.

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Retrieves the player name.
      Returns:
      The player name.

    • getGamesPlayed

      public int getGamesPlayed()
      Retrieves the number of games played.
      Returns:
      The number of games played.

    • getGamesWon

      public int getGamesWon()
      Retrieves the number of games won.
      Returns:
      The number of games won.

    • getGamesLost

      public int getGamesLost()
      Retrieves the number of games lost.
      Returns:
      The number of games lost.

    • getTimePlayed

      public String getTimePlayed()
      Retrieves the total time played in "mm:ss" format.
      Returns:
      The total time played.

    • getWinStreak

      public int getWinStreak()
      Retrieves the current win streak.
      Returns:
      The win streak.

    • getWinPercentage

      public double getWinPercentage()
      Retrieves the win percentage.
      Returns:
      The win percentage.
